effect.text: Attach PlusPower to your Active Pokémon. At the end of your turn, discard PlusPower. If this Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

tips: Calculate exact damage before using to avoid wasting PlusPower on overkill
Save PlusPowers for crucial KOs rather than using them casually
Multiple PlusPowers can be attached to the same Pokemon in one turn
Very effective in aggressive, fast-paced decks like Haymaker
Against Pokemon with Resistance, PlusPower helps overcome the damage reduction
Can turn 2HKOs into OHKOs, dramatically increasing offensive pressure

rulings.ruling: PlusPower is attached to your Active Pokemon when you play it from your hand
You can attach multiple PlusPowers to the same Pokemon in a single turn
Each PlusPower adds 10 damage, so 2 PlusPowers add 20 damage total
PlusPower is discarded at the end of your turn, after you attack
If your Active Pokemon is Knocked Out or retreats, attached PlusPowers are discarded
The damage is added after Weakness and Resistance calculations
PlusPower only affects damage done to the Defending (Active) Pokemon, not Benched Pokemon
If the attack does no damage (misses, fails, or does 0 base damage), PlusPower has no effect
PlusPower does not help with attacks that place damage counters rather than doing damage
